docs_detail: ETH Board Open Research Data (ORD) Program Project Metadata and Report Data

Source: R/docs_detail.R
docs_detail.Rd

This data package contains metadata and report data from 96 research projects funded by the joint Open Research Data (ORD) program of ETH Zurich, EPFL, and the four research institutes of the ETH Domain. The package includes project-level metadata, such as project titles, descriptions, and categorizations (Establish, Explore, Contribute), as well as data extracted from reports submitted by each project, providing insights into the projects' objectives, methods, outcomes, and impacts.

Usage

docs_detail

Format

A tibble with 7 rows and 19 variables

project_id

A unique identifier for each project, represented as a numerical value.

call_category

The category of the project call, with possible values including Explore and Contribute.

applicant_id

A unique identifier for the applicant, typically in the format ORD followed by a series of numbers.

main_applicant_institution_name

The name of the main institution associated with the applicant.

applicant_type

The type of applicant, categorized as either Primary or Secondary.

applicant_title

The title of the applicant, such as Prof. Dr.

applicant_first_name

The first name of the applicant.

applicant_last_name

The last name of the applicant.

applicant_institution

The institution affiliated with the applicant.

applicant_department_name

The name of the department within the applicant's institution.

applicant_lab_name

The name of the laboratory associated with the applicant.

applicant_orcid_id

The ORCID identifier for the applicant.

title

The title of the project.

acronym

A shortened acronym representing the project title.

abstract

A brief summary or abstract of the project.

keywords

Relevant keywords associated with the project.

project_start_dd_mm_yyyy

The start date of the project in the format DD.MM.YYYY.

project_duration_months

The duration of the project in months, represented as a numerical value.

funding_requested

The amount of funding requested for the project, represented as a numerical value.
